metadata.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Execution
metadata.comment: Detects Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (process.file.name is null AND endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe tunnel')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe tunnel')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--name ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--accept-server-license-terms')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower(' tunnel')) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/d /c ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\servers\\stable-')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('code-server.cmd'))))

output.summary: Detects Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate use of Visual Studio Code tunnel References: https://ipfyx.fr/post/visual-studio-code-tunnel/, https://badoption.eu/blog/2023/01/31/code_c2.html, https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/tunnels
